About Me


I'm Brandon Dean, a 2015 Virginia Tech graduate with a B.S. in Computer Science. I'm a software engineer currently based in Honolulu, HI.

I enjoy working on everything from mobile to web, backend to frontend. I am always learning something new, and I'm constantly reading and trying my hand at the latest in the industry. So feel free to reach out if you have something in mind that's not present in my work history!

In my spare time, you can find me exploring the outdoors hiking or in the ocean. And when indoors, either at the gym or catching up on my favorite TV shows.

Professionally, I have been working as a Software Engineer at Ikayzo in Honolulu, HI since November 2015. Prior to that, I was an Extreme Blue Intern at IBM in Raleigh, NC in the summer of 2013, and an intern at Virginia Interactive in Richmond, VA from Summer 2010 through Summer 2012.




Projects


Higa Auto Insurance

Designed & developed a web-app for Higa Insurance's taxi auto-insurance management, working with Angular 2 on the front-end and Rails server-side.


DRB - Student Loans

Worked with an international team as a developer on a student loan refinancing Rails and React application for DRB.


UHF - Donations

Collaborated closely with the UH Foundation on their online donations application to bring their platform up-to-date and optimize the giving process.


Remote Desktop Mobile App

Developed an Android application with a team of interns using agile development practices.
